page.title: 04GAMEKEEPING 2
page.content:
The gamekeeper has to control animals which kill his stock. Foxes and mink may kill a hundred young pheasants at a time, just for the pleasure of killing. During a year, the gamekeeper kills forty or fifty adult foxes and about sixty cubs. He also kills about ten or twelve mink. Other predators are weasels, stoats, rats and birds of prey, although they usually kill for food.
Rabbits are not a great problem as their numbers are small. Deer destroy the bark on young trees, but there are not a great many of them. Badgers, also, live in this area.
